ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: getting started
ygData.msgSnippet: uhholy steed is gotten thru AA points, and is an option at level 59. ... From: carmacculloch To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com Sent: Tuesday, June 18, 2002 6:59 PM
ygData.messageBody:
uhholy steed is gotten thru AA points, and is an option at level 59.
----- Original Message -----
From: carmacculloch
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, June 18, 2002 6:59 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Re: getting started

I have a level 47 Sk atm what level do we get Unholy Steed? and what
are the components necessary for the spell?

Cynfyn MacCulloch 47 DE SK
Defender of the Faith
Saryn
--- In EverQuest@y..., "Su" <suceress@k...> wrote:
> Another class that might be good is shadowknight. The drawbacks:
Good races
> won't want to sell to you and some may even want to kill you. If
you play a
> darkelf the newbie grounds completely and totally suck but you get
pretty
> cool armor when you can manage to find all the stuff you need for
it. People
> don't think of shadowknights when they think of tanks. They don't
often
> invite them to group. I don't think they get the spell "gate".
> The bonuses: You make a decent tank, you can summon a pet to tank
for you
> while you med, you can lifetap to heal yourself, and you get a
spell that
> snares and dots a mob at the same time. You can solo alot and are a
good
> asset to a group. Way later in the game you get to summon your own
horse
> called an Unholy Steed.
> My brother started a shadowknight and got him to lvl 35 in 8 days.
>
